basics.name: Dennis A. Garcia
basics.label: Electrical Engineering and Physics Student
basics.summary: Undergraduate student pursuing a dual degree in Electrical+Systems Engineering and Physics.

work.name: L&S Lighting Corporation | Norcross, GA
work.summary: Designed and documented lighting fixtures by converting legacy inventory into parametric 3D models and technical drawings. Improved efficiency in modeling, documentation, and product validation.
highlights: Created parametric CAD models and technical drawings in Fusion 360, Inventor, and AutoCAD.
Developed an in-house configurator, reducing custom modeling time by 60%
Standardized CAD files and inventory records, improving retrieval efficiency.
Accelerated certification processes by producing precise, standardized documentation.

work.name: College of Science and Mathematics, University of North Georgia
work.summary: Assisted students with lab experiments, graded reports, and helped clarify physics concepts in class and report writing.
highlights: Reviewed and provided feedback on lab reports for clarity and accuracy.
Reinforced physics concepts through hands-on assistance in laboratory work.

volunteer.organization: Engineering Student Guild | University of North Georgia
volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: NSF STEMs Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded competitive funding for academic excellence as a low-income STEM major, supporting retention and graduation.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Awarded an achievement for maintaining the Dean's List for 3 consecutive semesters of full time enrollment.

awards.title: Bridge Building Competition Winner
awards.summary: Designed and constructed the most efficient bridge structure in an engineering competition.

publications.name: A Mixed Finite Element Approximation of pre-Darcy Flows
publications.publisher: The North Carolina Journal of Mathematics and Statistics
publications.summary: Developed a mixed finite element method for modeling pre-Darcy flows in slightly compressible fluids, analyzing stability and error estimates through numerical simulations.

references.name: Dr. Thinh Kieu
references.reference: Physics professor at UNG, author of A Mixed Finite Element Approximation of pre-Darcy Flows

references.name: Dr. Jianjun Yang
references.reference: Computer Science professor at UNG. Lead the image processing and transformation project.

projects.name: Rocket Trajectory Simulation & CFD Analysis
projects.summary: Developed a 3D simulation incorporating aerodynamic modeling, RK45 integration, and numerical methods for trajectory prediction. Improved visualization and animation by transitioning from MATLAB to Python.
highlights: Implemented aerodynamic modeling and RK45 numerical integration.
Developed 3D transformations for realistic trajectory visualization.
Enhanced simulation animations using MANIM and Python.

projects.name: Image Manipulation CS Project
projects.summary: Developed algorithms for image processing using homographic transformations in collaboration with Dr. Jianjun Yang. Implemented color matrix parsing and automated feature detection for enhanced image analysis.
highlights: Designed algorithms for image transformations using homographic techniques.
Utilized libraries for automated color matrix parsing and feature detection.
Refactored code across multiple languages for optimization.

projects.name: Garcia Mechanical
projects.summary: Founded a machining shop focused on manufacturing aluminum hardware and providing electrical and software solutions. Revamped control systems using EE/ME principles and delivered pro-bono signage for municipal departments.
highlights: Established a machining shop with a gantry mill and restored lathe.
Designed and machined aluminum hardware for local businesses.
Implemented electrical and mechanical control system upgrades.
Provided pro-bono signage for municipal departments.
